content.story_intro: Nation-state attack (Russia) targeting Ukraine que se propagó globally

steps.title: Vector: Supply Chain
steps.content: NotPetya entró vía M.E.Doc (Ukrainian tax software). Attackers comprometieron update server, pushed malicious update. 80% de Ukrainian companies usaban M.E.Doc.
steps.insight: Supply chain attack bypassa todas las defensas. Trust en vendor = single point of failure.

steps.title: Propagation: EternalBlue + More
steps.content: NotPetya usó EternalBlue (SMB) + Mimikatz (credential theft) + PsExec + WMI. Multi-vector propagation. Lateral movement rapidísimo.
steps.insight: Worm moderno usa TODAS las técnicas. No solo un exploit, sino full arsenal.

steps.title: Payload: Wiper, Not Ransom
steps.content: Disfrazado como ransomware, pero MBR overwrite = unrecoverable. No decryption key real. Goal: destruction, not money. Maersk, Merck, FedEx devastados. $10B+ damages.
steps.insight: Geopolitical cyber warfare tiene collateral damage global. NotPetya: aimed at Ukraine, hit world.

back.definition: Attacker intercepts communication entre dos parties. Read, modify, inject traffic. Requiere position en network path.
back.example: ARP spoofing en LAN. Rogue WiFi AP. DNS hijacking. Defensa: TLS/HTTPS end-to-end, certificate pinning, DNSSEC.

back.definition: Capturar legit network traffic y re-enviar later para gain unauthorized access. Old pero efectivo contra weak protocols.
back.example: Capture authentication packet, replay para login. Defensa: Nonces, timestamps, session tokens, TLS with forward secrecy.

back.definition: Exploit APIs sin proper authentication, rate limiting, input validation. Scraping, credential stuffing, business logic bypass.
back.example: Enumerate users, brute force tokens, bypass payment. Defensa: API gateway, rate limiting, OAuth, input validation.

options.feedback: Incorrecto. NotPetya usó EternalBlue que ya era conocido (MS17-010 patch existía). No era zero-day.

options.text: Multi-vector: Supply chain + EternalBlue + Mimikatz + lateral movement tools
options.feedback: CORRECTO! NotPetya combinó: 1) Supply chain (M.E.Doc trojanized update), 2) EternalBlue (SMB exploit), 3) Mimikatz (credentials), 4) PsExec/WMI (lateral movement). Single defense no era suficiente. Defense in depth necesario.
Incorrecto. NotPetya ni siquiera era ransomware real, era wiper. Y sí es prevenible con: patching, segmentation, backups.
